intro: Draba ruaxes, commonly known as the Ruaxes whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Draba ruaxes produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and basal, forming a rosette structure that helps it conserve moisture in harsh conditions.
